intro: Beilschmiedia rohliana, commonly known as the Rohliana beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and produces small, clustered flowers followed by dark purple berries. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a prominent midrib, making it easily identifiable in its natural habitat. Beilschmiedia rohliana is often found in shaded understories of humid tropical forests, where it thrives in high humidity and nutrient-rich soils.
